newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Hapoalim to organise syndicated loan for Israel.
newsitem.headline: Hapoalim to organise syndicated loan for Israel.

text.p: A group of banks headed by Bank Hapoalim will organise a consortium of foreign banks to lend $200 million to Israel, Accountant General Shai Talmon said.
The group headed by Bank Hapoalim includes Natwest, BNP of France, Bayerische Landesbank of Germany and Dai Ichi Kangyo of Japan.
Hapoalim committed itself to raising a seven-year $200 million loan with a five-year grace period at an interest rate of 0.25-0.3 percent above Libor. The loan will be raised at the end of October.
Deputy Accountant General Avi Elkind said the offers submitted this year were the best ever received because the duration of the loan was longer and the interest rate lower.
Last year Israel raised 350 million marks through a consortium organised by Bank Leumi. It was a five-year loan with interest of 0.45 to 0.5 percent above Libor.
